schema.title: Vite Prod Builder
schema.description: Builds a Vite.js application for production.

outputPath.description: The output path of the generated files.

buildLibsFromSource.description: Read buildable libraries from source instead of building them separately.

skipTypeCheck.description: Skip type-checking via TypeScript. Skipping type-checking speeds up the build but type errors are not caught.

base.description: Base public path when served in development or production.

configFile.description: The name of the Vite.js configuration file.

fileReplacements.description: Replace files with other files in the build.

emptyOutDir.description: When set to false, outputPath will not be emptied during the build process.

sourcemap.description: Output sourcemaps. Use 'hidden' for use with error reporting tools without generating sourcemap comment.

target.description: Browser compatibility target for the final bundle. For more info: https://vitejs.dev/config/build-options.html#build-target

minify.description: Output sourcemaps. Use 'hidden' for use with error reporting tools without generating sourcemap comment.

manifest.description: Output sourcemaps. Use 'hidden' for use with error reporting tools without generating sourcemap comment.

ssrManifest.description: When set to true, the build will also generate an SSR manifest for determining style links and asset preload directives in production. When the value is a string, it will be used as the manifest file name.

ssr.description: Produce SSR-oriented build. The value can be a string to directly specify the SSR entry, or true, which requires specifying the SSR entry via rollupOptions.input.

mode.description: Mode to run the build in.

force.description: Force the optimizer to ignore the cache and re-bundle

cssCodeSplit.description: Enable/disable CSS code splitting. When enabled, CSS imported in async chunks will be inlined into the async chunk itself and inserted when the chunk is loaded.

generatePackageJson.description: Generate a package.json for the build output.

includeDevDependenciesInPackageJson.description: Include devDependencies in the generated package.json.
